info.title: BoxPay APIs
info.description:
## Introduction

The BoxPay API operates on the [REST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/REST) protocol. Our API features predictable resource-oriented URLs, accepts JSON-format request bodies, returns JSON-format responses, and adheres to standard HTTP response codes, authentication, and verbs.

You have the option to use the BoxPay API in test mode, ensuring it doesn't impact your live data or interact with the banking networks. The choice between live mode and test mode is determined by the base URL used for making the API request.


With BoxPay's Payments APIs, you can implement and manage a powerful payments solution with a wide range of features, including:

1. Online payments via [Payment Links](https://developers.boxpay.tech/docs/checkout-integration/payment-links/), [Hosted Checkout Page](https://developers.boxpay.tech/docs/checkout-integration/checkout-session/) or custom [Payment APIs](https://developers.boxpay.tech/docs/api-integration/) based integrations
2. Payouts


Not sure where to start? See our guide to [Merchant Onboarding](https://developers.boxpay.tech/docs/merchant-onboarding/).

post.description: This endpoint initiates a payment transaction for a specified merchant.

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: Idempotency key to ensure that operation is NOT executed twice for same request. For more details, please refer to 'Idempotency' section in API Reference.

parameters.name: merchantId
parameters.description: BoxPay unique ID assigned to Merchants

code.description: Code provided by BoxPay to merchant business units. It helps manage multiple business units of merchants and look at the payments, reports, charts etc. for all or specific business units

LegalEntityContext.description: Details of your business unit / legal entity

Money.description: Money details containing amount and currency

OrderDetails.description: Order details containing items being sold

frontendReturnUrl.description: URL where shoppers will be redirected to, after successful payments

frontendBackUrl.description: URL where shoppers will be redirected to, if they choose to cancel the payment

statusNotifyUrl.description: Webhook URL to get payment status notifications. You can also register webhooks through the Merchant Dashboard

additionalProperties.description: Key-value pairs for storing additional information about the payment request. A maximum of 7 key-value pairs is allowed Each pair should have a not-null key with a maximum of 20 characters and a not-null value with a maximum of 100 characters.

metadata.description: Key-value pairs for storing additional information about the payment request. A maximum of 7 key-value pairs is allowed Each pair should have a not-null key with a maximum of 20 characters and a not-null value with a maximum of 100 characters.

ShopperAuthentication.description: Specifies the shopper authentication (3DS, SCA etc.) settings. These may not always be honoured as some countries/geographies or payment gateways will have mandatory authentication like India

token.description: Inquiry token received in 'redirectionResult' query parameter in case of BoxPay checkout redirection. One of token or inquiryDetails is required.

frontendReturnUrl.description: URL where shoppers will be redirected to, after successful payments

frontendBackUrl.description: URL where shoppers will be redirected to, if they choose to cancel the payment

statusNotifyUrl.description: Webhook URL to get payment status notifications. You can also register webhooks through the Merchant Dashboard

additionalProperties.description: Key-value pairs for storing additional information about the payment request. A maximum of 5 key-value pairs is allowed Each pair should have a not-null key with a maximum of 20 characters and a not-null value with a maximum of 100 characters.

metadata.description: Key-value pairs for storing additional information about the payment request. A maximum of 5 key-value pairs is allowed Each pair should have a not-null key with a maximum of 20 characters and a not-null value with a maximum of 100 characters.

expiryDurationSec.description: Duration in seconds after which the session will be expired

onDemandAmount.description: Specifies whether amount is variable, to be entered by user

PaymentCheckoutRequest.description: Request model for creating a checkout session

SubscriptionDetails.description: Subscription details, contains details of subscription to be shown on checkout

additionalProperties.description: Map of URLs with UTM parameters for different tracking mediums

trackingUrls.description: Map of URLs with UTM parameters for different tracking mediums

PaymentSessionResponse.description: Payment link/checkout Response containing URL and token

frontendReturnUrl.description: URL where shoppers will be redirected to, after successful payments

frontendBackUrl.description: URL where shoppers will be redirected to, if they choose to cancel the payment

statusNotifyUrl.description: Webhook URL to get payment status notifications. You can also register webhooks through the Merchant Dashboard

additionalProperties.description: Key-value pairs for storing additional information about the payment request. A maximum of 4 key-value pairs is allowed Each pair should have a not-null key with a maximum of 20 characters and a not-null value with a maximum of 100 characters.

metadata.description: Key-value pairs for storing additional information about the payment request. A maximum of 4 key-value pairs is allowed Each pair should have a not-null key with a maximum of 20 characters and a not-null value with a maximum of 100 characters.

expiryDurationSec.description: Duration in seconds after which the session will be expired

onDemandAmount.description: Specifies whether amount is variable, to be entered by user

title.description: Can be used to specify purpose of payment for the payment link, to your end customers

productCode.description: Unique code of product that you want to generate payment link for. Depending on the value of 'externalProduct', it will be resolved either using products created in BoxPay or using your configured product API.

description.description: Detailed description of purpose of payment for the payment link, to your end customers

notifyViaEmail.description: Specifies whether payment link should be shared with customer via specified email. Applicable only when shopper.email field is provided.

notifyViaSms.description: Specifies whether payment link should be shared with customer via specified phone number. Applicable only when shopper.phoneNumber field is provided.

PaymentLinkRequest.description: Request for creating a payment link

API Key.description: API Key to call BoxPay APIs. You can fetch API Key from 'API Credentials' page under 'Developers' menu from the sidebar in Merchant Dashboard.
API Key.name: Authorization
